questions.question_text: Which ospf area prevent LSA type 4, LSA type 5? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Stub prevent Type 5, Totally Stub Type 4
According the reference link right answers: B D

questions.answer_description:
Tottaly NSSA and NSSA convert LSA 7 into LSA 5 so in this case LSA 5 is permitting
Tottaly Stub and Stub DO NOT allow LSA 4,5 instead they inject default route

Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/open-shortest-path-first-ospf/13703-8.html#anc2

questions.question_text: What following parameters for the EIGRP authentication need to match in order for EIGRP neighbors to establish a neighbor relationship?

comments.content: The question specifies "for the EIGRP authentication". C is the correct answer.

choices.C: If authentication is used both: the key number, the password, and the date/time.
choices.D: The neighbors must be on common subnet (all IGPs follow this rule).

questions.question_text: Which the Valid range for BGP private ASNs?

discussion.content:
OK. Agree - A.

"Private autonomous system (AS) numbers which range from 64512 to 65535 are used to conserve globally unique AS numbers."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/13756-32.html#topic1

MAN this is an unfair question. I don't think authentication is mentioned in the question. I will say, however, I've had routers drop OSPF adjacencies due to MTU mismatches. They would reform, but I've seen them drop. I REALLY think AD are the best answers but E has some merit.

I think the answers should be B and E.

If the timers are mis-matched, OSPF will not form a relationship with any neighbors in the area at all. The question specifies that the neighbor relationship is failing on only one interface, which indicates that the problem is limited to just the neighbor router. Authentication and MTU are both set on a per-interface basis, not an area basis.

choices.C: process id of ospf not match

questions.question_text:
Using new backup router in spite of faulty one in ospf domain but relationship with neighbor in one interface only not working, what is the reason of this problem?
(Choose two)

choices.A: Using the Bellman-Ford algorithm, each OSPF router independently calculates its best paths to all destinations in the network.
choices.F: When a link changes state, the router that detected the change creates a link-state advertisement (LSA) and propagates it to all OSPF devices using the 224.0.0.6 multicast address. CD
choices.B: Using the DUAL algorithm, each OSPF router independently calculates its best paths to all destinations in the network.
choices.C: OSPF sends summaries of individual link-state entries every 30 minutes to ensure LSDB synchronization.
choices.D: OSPF sends triggered updates when a network change occurs.

discussion.content:
C. OSPF sends summaries of individual link-state entries every 30 minutes to ensure LSDB synchronization.
D. OSPF sends triggered updates when a network change occurs.

questions.answer_description:
The point of this question is the basis of OSPF.
Incorrect answer A. OSPF send hello packets every 10 seconds, not the updates, OSPF sends triggered updates when a network change occurs. For OSPF, D
Rother use the multicast address 224.0.0.6 to send packets to DR and BDR, only DR and BDR can get the information from this multicast address.
questions.question_text: Which two statements are true of the OSPF link-state routing protocol? (Choose two.)
